StringTable.Label: Event_Pods_Dec
StringTable.String: Our scouts report that significant portions of {PLANETNAME} are inhabited by sentient pod-like creatures. These pods bond with other sentient life. Those who are bonded by these pods experience heightened intelligence but also display an alarming lack of morality. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Pods_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Excellent! Require our colonists to be 'introduced' to these pods.

StringTable.Label: Event_Pods_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Destroy the pods, we don't want to risk the health of our colony.

StringTable.Label: Event_Pods_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Keep our people away from those things. No one should have to live in agony.

StringTable.Label: Event_FragileCrust_Dec
StringTable.String: There is a disgusting amount of organic life crawling across the surface of {PLANETNAME}. It is a place of rot and refuse unsuited for our perfect forms. A massive fault line runs across the planet's crust. Our advisors suggest that a few well placed detonations could clear out this organic waste and expose more of the planet's wealth for collection. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_FragileCrust_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: No, don't fracture the world. Instead convert it for our use.

StringTable.Label: Event_FragileCrust_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Do not harm the planet, all life is sacred.

StringTable.Label: Event_CausticVapors_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} has vast reserves of trapped underground gasses. They occasionally erupt and cover city sized areas in grey ash. The vapors are heavy enough that they push all of the oxygen out of the affected region and kill most organic life. Fortunately the vapors have little effect on us and seem a reasonable precaution against the proliferation of organic life. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_CausticVapors_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Place our colony near one of the vapor geysers.

StringTable.Label: Event_CausticVapors_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Puncture the largest geysers and flood the world with the vapors.

StringTable.Label: Event_CausticVapors_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Cap the vapor geysers so that the world can better sustain organic life.

StringTable.Label: Event_SentientPlanet_Dec
StringTable.String: A small group of aliens you initially mistake for a copse of trees lives here. They claim they can speak with {PLANETNAME}. They offer to show you how. Although the planet seems disinterested in your day to day affairs, it might be possible to communicate with it further. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_SentientPlanet_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Begin communicating with the planet, ask it how to best live in harmony with it.

StringTable.Label: Event_SentientPlanet_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Invite the aliens to join your colony.

StringTable.Label: Event_SentientPlanet_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Threaten the planet with deep core mining unless it reveals its secrets.

StringTable.Label: Event_Earthquakes_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} is tectonically active, with regular earthquakes and volcanic eruptions. On the plus side, this is bringing a lot of valuable minerals up the surface, where it will be far easier to extract. On the downside, a lot of people are being killed by lava. Your engineers think they can stabilize the crust to stop the earthquakes, but the decision on whether to implement it hasn't been made yet. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Earthquakes_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: We can't risk the safety of our people. Stabilize the crust.

StringTable.Label: Event_Earthquakes_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Move people to the most secure structures. Then ramp up our mining efforts.

StringTable.Label: Event_Earthquakes_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: This colony is now a mining camp and everyone can just deal with it.

StringTable.Label: Event_Swamped_Dec
StringTable.String: Upon landing on {PLANETNAME}, you quickly realize that it has been inhabited before. Beneath the northern ice, explorers have found a ruined starship with an active Leaching Field module which will reduce the shield strength of enemy ships in battle. Your colonists believe they can extract the module, but the resulting melt will flood much of the arable land on the planet; the climate change will kill most of the unique native species. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Swamped_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Set land aside for the native species. Leave the ship buried, but study its technology.

StringTable.Label: Event_Swamped_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: There's too much life in the universe as it is and this module can help our military.

StringTable.Label: Event_Ruins_Dec
StringTable.String: The primitive species that occupies {PLANETNAME} was once far more technologically advanced, and accidentally ruined their civilization in some kind of nuclear war several hundred years ago. Ruined cities dot the planet except for one bunker with an active missile defense system. But the natives regard this bunker as sacred, and insist we stay away from it. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Ruins_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Respect the dead and declare the bunker off limits.

StringTable.Label: Event_Ruins_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Excavate the bunker and claim the missile defense system.

StringTable.Label: Event_SmartPlants_Dec
StringTable.String: There's substantial evidence that much of the plant life on {PLANETNAME} is communicating with each other via pheromones, and that it may in fact be sentient. Unfortunately for us, the most intelligent of the plants seem to prefer the most fertile ground, which we had earmarked for colonization. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_SmartPlants_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Attempt to communicate with the plants.

StringTable.Label: Event_SmartPlants_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: If there's sentient life, we won't butcher it.

StringTable.Label: Event_SmartPlants_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: We need to feed our colonists. Rip the plants out by the roots.

StringTable.Label: Event_SmartPlantsSuccess_Dec
StringTable.String: Our scientists have been able to communicate with the plants on {PLANETNAME}. We have learned much about plants that we can apply across our empire.

StringTable.Label: Event_SmartPlantsFail_Dec
StringTable.String: Our attempts to communicate with the plants on {PLANETNAME} somehow offended them. They withered in response, as did the areas they inhabited.

StringTable.Label: Event_Worms_Dec
StringTable.String: The location of our colony on {PLANETNAME} is apparently the prime hunting grounds for a species of massive, building-sized worms. This is by far the most fertile land on the planet, so we don't want to move if we don't have to. But on the other hand, massive building sized worms. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Worms_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Protect the mega-fauna, it will be a surprise for invaders.

StringTable.Label: Event_Worms_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: The worms may have been here first, but we have bigger guns. Wipe them out.

StringTable.Label: Event_StrangeFungus_Dec
StringTable.String: A strange fungus on {PLANETNAME} has begun infecting our colonists with an illness that is immune to our medicine. Although our doctors can treat the symptoms easily enough, they have no hope of finding a cure, and the risk of contagion is high. With this disease afflicting us, our colony will never see its full growth potential. Some argue that we should cull the diseased to protect the rest of the colony. Others, notably the diseased, argue against this. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_StrangeFungus_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Don't cull anyone. Even if we never find a cure, we won't become monsters.

StringTable.Label: Event_StrangeFungus_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Quarantine the people who have the disease and prevent them from reproducing.

StringTable.Label: Event_StrangeFungus_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Cull them. Our descendants will thank us for having the courage to do this.

StringTable.Label: Event_High-GAnimalRacing_Dec
StringTable.String: Colonists on {PLANETNAME} have taken to breeding and racing a local species of squat, four-legged animals. The harsh gravity of the world makes the races particularly gruelling, and footage of injured animals has caused animal rights activists around the galaxy to demand this barbaric practice be stopped. But it's become a big part of the local culture, and the colonists won't be happy if we end the races. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_High-GAnimalRacing_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: We must, of course, stop anything which even suggests cruelty to other forms of life.

StringTable.Label: Event_High-GAnimalRacing_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Export the footage across our civilization so everyone can enjoy the races.

StringTable.Label: Event_High-GAnimalRacing_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Promote the man behind this. Exploiting the weak is the foundation of our empire.

StringTable.Label: Event_AlienCulturalTrash_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} was once the home of an alien civilization which disappeared a thousand years earlier. Although none of their technology is new, many of their entertainment products remain intact, and are of great interest to the colonists. Unfortunately almost all of these shows and programs are incredibly childish and puerile, featuring an unfortunate amount of jokes about orifices. The colony's workplaces are now filled with practical jokes that sap productivity. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_AlienCulturalTrash_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Leave them be. They're adults who can make their own decisions.

StringTable.Label: Event_AlienCulturalTrash_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Let's at least try distributing this trash on the open market.

StringTable.Label: Event_AlienCulturalTrash_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Ban the trash, then laughter for a time to teach everyone a lesson.

StringTable.Label: Event_AggressiveNatives_Dec
StringTable.String: An aggressive species of sentient quadrupeds live in the forests and hills of {PLANETNAME}. They've resisted all attempts to communicate with them, and have relentlessly attacked your colony since you arrived. Although no actual threat to you militarily, they can harass and easily slaughter unguarded civilians. As is so often the case when the risk of slaughter is non-zero, morale amongst the colonists is low. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_AggressiveNatives_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Isolate the land these creatures live on. We can share this world.

StringTable.Label: Event_AggressiveNatives_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Toughen up. Colonists have to be ready to face risks.

StringTable.Label: Event_AggressiveNatives_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Capture these creatures for our invasions.

StringTable.Label: Event_AggressiveNatives2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our isolation of the native quadrupeds on {PLANETNAME} was unsuccessful. They somehow escaped confinement and attacked our colony. Those that survived will never forget the attack.

StringTable.Label: Event_AggressiveNatives2_Liberty_Bonus_Dec
StringTable.String: Citizens become Traumatized on this planet

StringTable.Label: Event_Haunted_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} colonists report a variety of strange disturbances: Doors which open and close on their own, strange lights in the night; a mysterious hole in the ground which screams. Your scientists seem to think the colony might be haunted. "Building on the ruins of a previously failed colony may have been a bad idea," they say. "Also, underneath that colony was another failed colony. Which was built on a graveyard." What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Haunted_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Warn the colonists and move the colony somewhere less haunted.

StringTable.Label: Event_Haunted_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Fix the doors, fix the lights, and put some boards over the hole that screams.

StringTable.Label: Event_Haunted_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: It is superstition. Hide all evidence of supernatural activity.

StringTable.Label: Event_PowerfulDrug_Dec
StringTable.String: The flowers of a specific plant on {PLANETNAME} are a powerful intoxicant. The drug provides an intense feeling of contentment to all those who consume it, although in a few cases people have been content to walk directly into powerful machinery. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_PowerfulDrug_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Put in railings and let people use the drug recreationally.

StringTable.Label: Event_PowerfulDrug_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Make the drug illegal, but begin research efforts to find market uses for it.

StringTable.Label: Event_PowerfulDrug_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Content workers are hard workers. Give them more of the drug.

StringTable.Label: Event_Comet_Dec
StringTable.String: A comet has reentered the solar system of {PLANETNAME} after a fifty year absence, throwing a primitive local species into a frenzy. They apparently worship this regularly returning visitor as a god. Your scientists report that this comet is at least partly artificial, a relic apparently left in the Oort cloud by an advanced species. There may be some salvage potential in it, provided of course that we're willing to kill a god to get it. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Comet_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Invite the religious to come to the planet and worship the god comet.

StringTable.Label: Event_Comet_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Trap the comet in secret. Invite scientists to the planet to investigate what we find.

StringTable.Label: Event_Comet_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Kill the god, take the eye, use it to encourage our military.

StringTable.Label: Event_Comet_Authority_Bonus_Dec
StringTable.String: Free Eye of the Unknown God ship upgrade

StringTable.Label: Event_Thunderstorms_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} suffers from heavy thunderstorm activity. This is affecting an ancient ruin, revealing it to be a powerful alien artifact capable of drawing and channeling the tremendous energy. Sometimes this energy is channeled into the bodies of anyone standing nearby, with predictably messy consequences. Studying these ruins could prove incredibly valuable, although also dangerous to anyone who has to do it. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Thunderstorms_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Leave the ruins alone, they are protecting the world from the storms.

StringTable.Label: Event_Thunderstorms_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Invite scientists to the world to study the ruins, even if it might disrupt them.

StringTable.Label: Event_Thunderstorms_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Pull the technology out, no matter how many lives it costs.

StringTable.Label: Event_Thunderstorms_Authority_Bonus_Dec
StringTable.String: Free Beam Magnification Array ship upgrade

StringTable.Label: Event_SolarFlare_Dec
StringTable.String: An increased period of solar activity has caused a species of previously dormant insects to suddenly begin swarming, greatly limiting activity on {PLANETNAME}. Your scientists have developed a sonic screen which can kill the insects, but believe there may also be a way to expand the technology to rid the world of the swarm forever. What effects that will have on the ecosystem are as yet unknown. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_SolarFlare_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: If this technology kills en masse, then we won't use it.

StringTable.Label: Event_SolarFlare_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Abandon parts of the planet that the bugs inhabit.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeftoverRobots_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} was once the home of a fairly advanced alien species that created some extremely long lasting sub-sentient AI systems. Something you've done has triggered these systems defensive protocols. Now anyone who ventures outside of the colony is at risk of attack from primitive robotic creatures. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_LeftoverRobots_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Thin out the robots around the colony and feel a little guilty about it.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeftoverRobots_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Some clever programming should make sure the robots serve us instead.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeftoverRobots_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Make killing the robots a sport and invite others to play.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeftoverRobotsSuccess_Dec
StringTable.String: Our scientists have been able to take control of the planet's robots on {PLANETNAME}. After that, it is a simple matter to program them to perform subsurface drilling on the planet to reach mineral deposits that were out of the reach of our colonists. And, if we ever need it, we can switch them back to attack mode.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeftoverRobotsFail_Dec
StringTable.String: Our attempt to hack into the robots on {PLANETNAME} fails. Instead it triggers the robots to go into an even more aggressive mode where they view us as their primary target. We are still able to maintain our colony on {PLANETNAME}, but if we are ever invaded the invaders will discover a robotic army eager to help them out.

StringTable.Label: Event_SwarmLikeFish_Dec
StringTable.String: On {PLANETNAME} there is a species of fish which seems to possess a form of collective intelligence. The fish seem to become more intelligent the larger the group they're in. In the largest schools they can clearly communicate with us, and even seem to understand advanced concepts like space travel and where we're from. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_SwarmLikeFish_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Accommodate the fish. This is their home; we will be gracious guests.

StringTable.Label: Event_SwarmLikeFish_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Terraform the lakes to make them an ideal biome for the fish to grow.

StringTable.Label: Event_SwarmLikeFish_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Our colonists need food and fish are delicious.

StringTable.Label: Event_SwarmLikeFishSuccess_Dec
StringTable.String: We increase the size of the lakes and provide food for the fish on {PLANETNAME}. Just as we hoped, their collective intelligence grew exponentially. We had just begun to learn from them when they disappear, ascending to a dimension beyond ours. Still we made great strides in the short time we were together.

StringTable.Label: Event_SwarmLikeFishFail_Dec
StringTable.String: We increase the size of the lakes and provide food for the fish on {PLANETNAME}. Just as we hoped, their collective intelligence grew exponentially. Unfortunately, with their increased intelligence they decide they don't like us very much, a sentiment many share.

StringTable.Label: Event_SuperShark_Dec
StringTable.String: The waters of {PLANETNAME} are patrolled by a monstrously large creature, filled with teeth and ill will. It seems to have taken a particular interest in your colony and has already killed many of your colonists with its aforementioned teeth and ill will. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_SuperShark_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: We have no right to endanger a species that has survived for centuries.

StringTable.Label: Event_SuperShark_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Kill the shark and mount the skeleton in my throne room.

StringTable.Label: Event_SuperShark_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Setup some island castaways and see what they do when the super shark arrives.

StringTable.Label: Event_AnimalstoTame_Dec
StringTable.String: The terrain of {PLANETNAME} has proven very challenging for our conventional ground vehicles. Some colonists have begun capturing and taming a local species of marsupial to use for hopping around between buildings and colonies. The animals are well suited for the work, and don't seem to be suffering, but there have been a few accidents. Animal rights activists across the galaxy are demanding the practice be banned. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_AnimalstoTame_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: This is shockingly primitive. End the practice at once.

StringTable.Label: Event_AnimalstoTame_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Launch a campaign to convince your citizens the beasts are well treated.

StringTable.Label: Event_AnimalstoTame_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Not suffering? Then they aren't working hard enough.

StringTable.Label: Event_CollapsingIceBridge_Dec
StringTable.String: Two continents of {PLANETNAME} are joined by a massive ice bridge, which is beginning to collapse. A large Snuggler Colony makes their home on this bridge and are in danger of dying within the next year if they're not relocated. The ice bridge is remote however, and this won't come cheaply. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_CollapsingIceBridge_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Launch a save the Snuggler campaign.

StringTable.Label: Event_CollapsingIceBridge_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Rescue the Snugglers and relocate them to our warehouses.

StringTable.Label: Event_CollapsingIceBridge_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Let nature take its course. If any Snugglers survive, collect them when it is safe.

StringTable.Label: Event_WaterReclamation_Dec
StringTable.String: A new source of subterranean water has been discovered on {PLANETNAME}. If accessed it could dramatically help the colony. The water could be used to boost food production or even just people's quality of life. Baths might be possible again, for example. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_WaterReclamation_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Discontinue the colony's water restrictions and let people enjoy it.

StringTable.Label: Event_WaterReclamation_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Don't be wasteful with this bounty. Direct all the water to irrigating the fields.

StringTable.Label: Event_WaterReclamation_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Allow the local gangs to control the water supply in exchange for a kickback.

StringTable.Label: Event_Scorpions_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} is populated by a species of gigantic subterranean insects that are normally docile. Our scientists have identified that the walls of their nests are lined with Harmony Crystals which we could potentially excavate. This will not please the scorpions. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Scorpions_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Giant scorpions are more useful than crystals. Treat them well.

StringTable.Label: Event_Scorpions_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Collect the limited crystals we can without disturbing the scorpions.

StringTable.Label: Event_Scorpions_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Crush the insects. Take their valuables.

StringTable.Label: Event_MysteriousNatives_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} has a group of natives who carry relics far more advanced than their primitive technology. Their oral history gives hints that they arrived here from a long journey some hundreds of years earlier. Your scientists get the impression they're a failed colony which has regressed to pre-industrial levels. It's possible some of their relics could be of interest to your researchers, but they're quite valuable to the natives. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_MysteriousNatives_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Leave the natives be, but begin documenting their fascinating history.

StringTable.Label: Event_MysteriousNatives_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Invite the natives to join our colony.

StringTable.Label: Event_MysteriousNatives_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: These trinkets are better in our hands than theirs.

StringTable.Label: Event_Mutations_Dec
StringTable.String: Despite the equipment and protocols set up to protect against the massive radiation on {PLANETNAME}, mutations are a fact of life for those who live here. A talented local surgeon believes that the most extreme cases might not be worth the time spent to heal them. Instead he suggests that we use those subjects as organ harvest donors for the less critical patients. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Mutations_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Never. All our citizens deserve the best possible care.

StringTable.Label: Event_Mutations_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: It is a reasonable request. And we can make money from organ sales.

StringTable.Label: Event_Mutations_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: I like the way this surgeon thinks. Promote him into a government role.

StringTable.Label: Event_IntelligentRadiation_Dec
StringTable.String: The intense background radiation of {PLANETNAME} occasionally causes strange interference patterns in display screens around your colony; and recently these patterns have shown signs of intelligent thought. Your scientists trace the patterns to crystal outcroppings around your colony. [BR][BR]Studying this new form of intelligence could open the door to incredible breakthroughs in the understanding of life. On the other hand, those crystals are pretty valuable looking. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_IntelligentRadiation_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Attempt to communicate with the crystals.

StringTable.Label: Event_IntelligentRadiation_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Study the crystals to find out what's happening.

StringTable.Label: Event_IntelligentRadiation_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: The crystals are valuable. Mine and sell them.

StringTable.Label: Event_IntelligentRadiationSuccess_Dec
StringTable.String: The crystals of {PLANETNAME} continue to grow; the radiation increases until a single moment when it bursts into a blinding light. For a moment people across the galaxy report visions of other worlds, of other species, and of time itself. When it is over the crystals are gone but explorers are drawn to this world to study what happened.

StringTable.Label: Event_IntelligentRadiationFail_Dec
StringTable.String: We don't interfere with the crystals on {PLANETNAME}. Whatever the crystals needed to grow, they don't receive it. Instead they become dull and grey; and the radiation fades as well. You can't help but feel that something special died here.

StringTable.Label: Event_MiningAccidents_Dec
StringTable.String: Your geologists have come across an incredibly rich vein of rare minerals which could dramatically increase the economic output of {PLANETNAME}. Unfortunately, accessing them will release toxic gases trapped within the planet's crust. The colonists ask that these minerals be left alone. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_MiningAccidents_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Do what we can to extract the minerals safely.

StringTable.Label: Event_MiningAccidents_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Mine it all. Rare minerals are rare in a way that people aren't.

StringTable.Label: Event_FunnyTastingFood_Dec
StringTable.String: Food grown on {PLANETNAME} has a distinct taste. Locals don't notice anything unusual, but off-world visitors find it exceedingly strange and even exotic tasting. Of late, the outside world has developed a faddish taste for this colony's food, and there has been much demand for the export of it, even to the point of leaving this colony short of food. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_FunnyTastingFood_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Invite more colonists to the planet to increase production.

StringTable.Label: Event_FunnyTastingFood_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Use all available fertile land to grow more of the strange food.

StringTable.Label: Event_FunnyTastingFood_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: This isn't food, it's revenue. Export everything for sale.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeakingSeals_Dec
StringTable.String: A sudden increase in storm activity on {PLANETNAME} has dramatically increased the weathering of the seals on your colony buildings. A new generation of self-healing seals will help minimize the damage, but replacing them all could be pretty expensive. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_LeakingSeals_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Install the new seals, whatever the cost.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeakingSeals_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Install seals as the old ones break down.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeakingSeals_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: We can't afford that, this is what the colonists signed up for.

StringTable.Label: Event_BeautifulSunsets_Dec
StringTable.String: The atmosphere of {PLANETNAME}, thick with poisonous particulates, does have the side effect of causing beautiful, even spectacular sunsets, and word has spread through the galaxy of their beauty. A burgeoning tourist industry has developed, resulting in many coughing tourists, ignorant of the dangers of this planet. Your colonists are getting tired of stepping over their bodies. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_BeautifulSunsets_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Regulate this new industry. We can't kill our guests.

StringTable.Label: Event_BeautifulSunsets_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Inform tourists of the danger and provide safety gear.

StringTable.Label: Event_BeautifulSunsets_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Make the deaths look like they came from partying.

StringTable.Label: Event_BlackMarket_Dec
StringTable.String: There is an illegal black market operating on {PLANETNAME}. It is a haven for pirates and smugglers. They warmly receive our colonists, sharing maps of the planet and seem appreciative of the support and protection our colony provides. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_BlackMarket_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: The smugglers have a day to relocate. After that, arrest them.

StringTable.Label: Event_BlackMarket_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: The market can remain, but our laws will be enforced.

StringTable.Label: Event_BlackMarket_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Allow the market to continue to operate, this can benefit us as well.

StringTable.Label: ThuliumMoonEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: Long ago, the Precursors captured a small Thulium node and placed it in orbit of {PLANETNAME}. We will be able to use this ready source of Thulium to strengthen the hit points of ships made from our shipyard. Our scientists would also like to study it to see what else we can learn. Technology that can be used to create an artificial moon is not something to be squandered. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: ThuliumMoonEvent_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Use this technology to strengthen our ships.

StringTable.Label: ThuliumMoonEvent_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Use the moon as a weapons platform.

StringTable.Label: DurantiumCloudEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: An ancient Precursor race seems to have once inhabited {PLANETNAME}. They left behind a cloud of Durantium asteroids that are now orbiting the world. We will be able to use these to increase the efficiency of the Mass Drivers on our ships. However, we may also be able to use this ready source of Durantium for other purposes. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: DurantiumCloudEvent_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Use the Durantium to increase the production of this planet.

StringTable.Label: DurantiumCloudEvent_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Use the Durantium to increase the armor efficiency on all of our ships.

StringTable.Label: DurantiumCloudEvent_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Use the Durantium to focus on what's important: killing things.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorAcceleratorEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: An immense Precursor Accelerator is orbiting {PLANETNAME}. We have been able to tap this device to create even more powerful drive systems. All of our ships built here will benefit from a great increase in speed. Some of our scientists think they can use the accelerator to refine Elerium as well, and would like to do some experimentation. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: PrecursorAcceleratorEvent_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Use the Elerium to create a defense field for the colony.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorAcceleratorEvent_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Use this Elerium to increase the strength of our shield systems.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorAcceleratorEvent_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Put our energy toward making bigger explosions.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorElevatorEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: The Precursors who lived on {PLANETNAME} before us left behind a completely functional Space Elevator. This will greatly increase our ability to put manufactured goods into space and will prove very useful to our shipyard. Unfortunately, the public sector and several other groups are putting a great deal of pressure on us. They hope to use the elevator to facilitate their own projects. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: PrecursorElevatorEvent_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: They can use it as a vacation spot, as long as they don't block military traffic.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorElevatorEvent_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Allow some traders time on the Elevator.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorElevatorEvent_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: If they have spare time, they can lend it to the war effort.

StringTable.Label: PromethionRefineryEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: Two giant Precursor structures orbit the poles of {PLANETNAME}. They seem to have been used to somehow terraform a Promethion gas giant into a habitable world. We are able to use the Promethion stored in them to increase the range of any ships built by our shipyard. Our scientists think they can do more with these giant machines and would like your permission to study them further. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: PromethionRefineryEvent_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: See if they can find a way to terraform the surface.

StringTable.Label: PromethionRefineryEvent_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: See if there is any way to boost the value of the land we have now.

StringTable.Label: PromethionRefineryEvent_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: See what you can do to shut the complainers up. We have a galaxy to conquer.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorSatellitesEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: The former Precursor inhabitants left a large array of powerful satellites in orbit of {PLANETNAME}. We have been able to make use of them to extend both the sensor range of the planet and of the ships that are built here. Our researchers would like to capture one of these satellites for study and have assured us that it will not have any damaging effects on the array. A group of Navigator scientists has also shown an interest in investigating the satellites. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: PrecursorSatellitesEvent_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Focus on using the satellites to increase our sensor range.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorSatellitesEvent_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Put engines on the satellite and transform it onto a starbase.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorSatellitesEvent_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Invite scientists to come research the satellites.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorTreasuryEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} is surrounded by an immense Precursor ring. It's full of valuable assets that could be used to generate income. Unfortunately, it has already drawn the attention of multiple criminal groups that are harvesting the ring and fighting with each other. Although the pirates are no real threat to us, it will take a lot of work to guard against their constant attempts to harvest the ring. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: PrecursorTreasuryEvent_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Focus on protecting the ring. Destroy any pirates that get too close.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorTreasuryEvent_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Make a deal with the pirates. They can harvest the ring and we get a cut.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorTreasuryEvent_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Invite them to join the colony and give them rights to the ring.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorFactoryWorldEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: Through intense research, we have been able to use the ancient Precursor Factory orbiting {PLANETNAME} to increase our manufacturing output. Several members of the research team responsible for this have come forward with suggestions on how we can utilize this amazing new asset. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: PrecursorFactoryWorldEvent_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Use the excess manufacturing to improve the quality of life on this world.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorFactoryWorldEvent_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Remove some of the safety measures on the factory to boost the output.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorResearchWorldEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: The ancient array of Precursor research bases orbiting {PLANETNAME} are increasing the Research capacity for this world. Our researchers would like permission to see if they can find a way to specialize the focus of these new assets. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: PrecursorResearchWorldEvent_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Prepare the array to complete research on a single technology for us.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorResearchWorldEvent_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Use the array to manage our bureaucracy.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorPrisonEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we have cleaned the atmosphere, we can use the infrastructure of Precursor Prisons to increase the manufacturing quality of {PLANETNAME}. However, there seem to be many more discoveries that are... darker in nature. Echoes of the millions that died within the vast underground chambers. Should we take advantage of these assets? What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: PrecursorPrisonEvent_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Focus on building up our colony, not the dark past of this world.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorPrisonEvent_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Pre-made haunted murder cubes? Start moving people in!

StringTable.Label: PrecursorPrisonEvent_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Start shipping criminals from across our empire here for storage.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorExperimentalWorldEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: The giant Precursor Experimental Station orbiting {PLANETNAME} has become an amazing resource that is assisting the ability of this planet to create new devices. We have also found some interesting experiments that we may be able to complete with some extra work. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: PrecursorQuarantineEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: Cleaning up the atmosphere of {PLANETNAME} has shown it to be amazingly productive and resource rich. Our researchers have been studying the Precursor Containment Device that's orbiting the planet and think they can use it to further enhance this world's potential. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: PrecursorQuarantineEvent_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Focus on making this planet as comfortable for our colonists as possible.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorQuarantineEvent_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Use these technologies to increase the food capacity of the world.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorQuarantineEvent_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Increase the amount of usable land. We can make more people later.

StringTable.Label: Event_ColonizeMars_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} is an inhospitable home for organic life with the challenges of radiation exposure, toxic soil and low gravity. Still, we have identified three potential locations for colonies on the planet.[BR][BR]Ares Vallis is where Sojourner, the first Terran explorer outside of Earth, landed.[BR][BR]Eberswalde Delta is a delta in a delta.[BR][BR]Holden Crater has signs of microbial life that may indicate that the region is more suited for organic life.[BR][BR]Where would you like to build our colony?

StringTable.Label: Event_ColonizeMars_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Ares Vallis, where Sojourner once landed.

StringTable.Label: Event_ColonizeMars_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Eberswalde Delta, where we can extract additional minerals.

StringTable.Label: Event_ColonizeMars_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Holden Crater, where we can study signs of microbial life.

StringTable.Label: Event_ColonizeArtemis_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} is as inhospitable as we have seen so far. It is cold, barren and has a limited atmosphere and gravity. Still, our colony is deployed successfully and our colonists quickly set to turning this minor planet into a new home. It is an example of what our courage and ingenuity are able to accomplish. One corporation is very interested in {PLANETNAME} and offers a generous fee if we will allow them exclusive licensing rights to the fledgling colony.

StringTable.Label: Event_ColonizeArtemis_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: We should celebrate this achievement across our civilization.

StringTable.Label: Event_ColonizeArtemis_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Make this world a monument to our success and future expansion.

StringTable.Label: Event_ColonizeArtemis_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Allow the corporation to license rights to the colony.
